data.title: Good Mexican Food
data.text: Stayed nearby in Hampton. I guess this is a standard chain, the food is decent, and the staff is helpful. It is open till late as well.

data.title: First time at this one wont't be last
data.text: First of all we like Qdoba, second of all I don't always review these type of restaurants...so why this time? Quite simply I so enjoyed all employees we encountered that I wanted to do so. In a world where customer service has become so inconsistent when I experience the real thing I want to give credit. My son and I both got burritos and found the ingredients quite plentiful--it's nice not paying for guacamole. We asked for different ingredients on ours, but both liked the finished product.

data.title: Great food
data.text: My kids always beg for Qdoba.  Great food, good service.  Often busy at lunch time, but worth the wait.

data.title: First Time Customer ~ Very AVERAGE Experience
data.text:
I visited this chain of restaurant for the first time in March, while staying at the hotel located directly behind the restaurant.  I chose it for convenience, but also because I love Moe's and have eaten a couple of times at Chipotle, so I wanted to see how this compared.  The food was good.  It was exceptional in anyway, but it was tasty and I enjoyed what I ordered.  The service was not great.  I arrived about 1/2 prior to closing time, so I wasn't sure if the person was annoyed that I came in so late or if they just didn't enjoy dealing with customers.  

Since my visit to this Qdoba, I have seen them popping up in all over the place.  I may try one again, but there was nothing 'remarkable' about my experience that will cause me to make it a priority.

data.title: reliable but skimpy on ingredients as compared to Chipotle
data.text: This is a standard Qdoba. As is typical at Qdoba they are not very generous with the portions for what you pay for. Had a steak bowl and the steak was pretty tender but needed some of the fat trimmed off of it. I think Chipotle is much more generous with the portions - versus Qdoba which seems a little chincy.

data.title: It's about flavor….and people
data.text:
As fast-food mex goes, Qdoba has always been my favorite. More options than many of the other chains (Chipotle, Moe's) and the food is really flavorful. If you eat a piece of steak that's not covered in salsa or queso, it still has flavor and is not just an overcooked addition to the burrito.

But also, at least at this site, the people are almost always the friendliest I've encountered. Very helpful and often generous with the servings.

The only bad thing, as with all Qdobas (what is the plural of Qdoba? Qdobae?), is that with the cavernous ceiling the acoustics, if the dining area is busy, can be very loud.

But honestly, after the first few bites, you won't notice the noise! :)

data.title: attitude adjustment
data.text:
We stopped by for multigeneration family lunch during a holiday visit on a Saturday afternoon, and the place got busy warranting a noticeably more (than other servers) mature gentleman (manager perhaps) at the 1st station in the serving line.  His demeanor was annoyed rather than helpful as guests made their menu choice.  His exchange w/the co-workers was not team enhancing and his abrupt tone w/2 quiet gentlemen who seemed to be having difficulty reading the menu due, perhaps to unfamiliarity w/the language although clearly familiar w/Mexican food, was not to be overlooked.  Children observing did not see an ideal modeling moment.  

It has been a few months since stopping there but it came to mind because we'll be in the area again this weekend and is still clear in my memory.  And not in a good way.  Although the food was above average I will not vote to stop there again.

data.title: They know me by name!
data.text: The staff at this Qdoba are the nicest bunch of people around! Honestly the people know me and what I get.. I don't even go in that often..but they know every time!
